uk.ac.ebi.brain.core

Class Brain

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.ebi.brain.core.Brain

  • public class Brain
extends Object
    Facade class to manipulate the OWL-API. The documentation is available at https://github.com/loopasam/Brain/wiki
    Author:
    Samuel Croset

    • Constructor Detail

      • Brain

        public Brain(String prefix,
     String ontologyIri)
      throws NewOntologyException,
             BadPrefixException
        Creates a Brain instance with the specified prefix and ontology IRI. The OWL entities created will inherit from this prefix. The number of working threads for reasoning is set to the maximum (default).
        Parameters:
        prefix -
        ontologyIri -
        Throws:
        BadPrefixException
        NewOntologyException

      • Brain

        public Brain()
      throws NewOntologyException,
             BadPrefixException
        Creates a Brain instance with the a default prefix () and ontology IRI (). The number of working threads for reasoning is set to the maximum (default).
        Throws:
        BadPrefixException
        NewOntologyException

      • Brain

        public Brain(org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLOntology ontology)
      throws NewOntologyException
        Creates a Brain instance from an ontology object. This method is useful for people with a pre-loaded ontology in memory and willing to quickly create a Brain instance from it. The default prefix () and ontology IRI () are used. The number of working threads for reasoning is set to the maximum (default).
        Parameters:
        ontology -
        Throws:
        BadPrefixException
        NewOntologyException

      • Brain

        public Brain(String prefix,
     String ontologyIri,
     int numberOfWorkers)
      throws NewOntologyException,
             BadPrefixException
        Creates a Brain instance with the specified prefix and ontology IRI. The OWL entities created will inherit from this prefix. The number of working threads for reasoning is set to the passed value (numberOfWorkers parameter).
        Parameters:
        prefix -
        ontologyIri -
        numberOfWorkers -
        Throws:
        BadPrefixException
        NewOntologyException

      • isClassified

        public boolean isClassified()

      • prefix

        public void prefix(String longForm,
          String abbreviation)
        Declare a prefix mapping. Will be used when the ontology is serialized (.owl file). Example of usage: 
         Brain brain = new Brain();
 brain.prefix("http://www.example.org/", "example");
        Parameters:
        longForm -
        abbreviation -

      • addClass

        public org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLClass addClass(String className)
                                               throws BadNameException,
                                                      ExistingClassException
        Add an OWL class to the ontology. An OWLClass object is returned. The input value can either be the short form of the class or the full IRI. Examples of input parameter: "http://example.org/MyClass" or "MyClass".
        Parameters:
        className -
        Returns:
        owlClass
        Throws:
        ExistingClassException
        BadNameException

      • addNamedIndividual

        public org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLNamedIndividual addNamedIndividual(String individualName)
                                                                   throws BadNameException,
                                                                          ExistingNamedIndividualException
        Add an OWL named individual to the ontology. An OWLNamedIndividual object is returned. The input value can either be the short form of the property or the full IRI. Examples of input parameter: "http://example.org/MyIndividual" or "MyIndividual".
        Parameters:
        individualName -
        Returns:
        owlNamedIndividual
        Throws:
        BadNameException
        ExistingNamedIndividualException

      • learn

        public void learn(Brain brainToLearn)
           throws ExistingEntityException
        Load another brain object. The axioms are extracted and merged with the current one.
        Throws:
        NewOntologyException
        ExistingEntityException

      • classify

        public void classify()
        Classify the ontology. It is usually the most expensive operation, so use it carefully!

      • hasElProfile

        public boolean hasElProfile()
        Test whether the ontology is following an OWL 2 EL profile or not.
        Returns:
        hasElProfile

      • getElProfileViolations

        public List<String> getElProfileViolations()
        Returns the list of violations of the OWL 2 EL profile.
        Returns:
        violations

      • getSubClasses

        public List<String> getSubClasses(String classExpression,
                         boolean direct)
                           throws ClassExpressionException
        Returns the list of subclasses from the expression. The second parameter is a flag telling whether only the direct classes should be returned. The method is synchronized in order to avoid concurrency problems that could arise in threaded environment (such as a web server with a shared Brain instance).
        Parameters:
        classExpression -
        direct -
        Returns:
        subClasses
        Throws:
        ClassExpressionException

        Returns:
        unsatisfiableClasses

      • sleep

        public void sleep()
        Free the resources used by the reasoner. Once this method is called, the reasoner is destroyed and replaced by a fresh one. Re-classification is needed before re-querying.

      • knowsClass

        public boolean knowsClass(String owlClass)
        Checks if the class (short form) is already inside the brain. Useful while parsing in order to avoid errors.
        Returns:
        whether the class is known or not.
